Text: Make sure to mount the iso with Toast and not with Disk Utility. If you're getting no-cd errors that's why.

this works perfectly, thanks!
just mount the iso file with toast titanium and then copy the whole folder "The Sims" to your computer (this is to solve the issue with the file name which contains slash, backslash etc)  and then go in that folder, double click on the file "The Sims Complete" and play! you don't need to install anything

cheers!

Got it working perfectly via the following:
1. Mount with Disk Utility and copy 'The Sims' directory to your local drive
2. Eject the Disk Utility mount and remount with Toast
3. Open the application 'The Sims Complete'

As others have pointed out, it'll only work on 10.6.x and below. If it doesn't - you may not have Rosetta installed (as it's optional). You can manually install it from your OSX install disc.
